paper.title: The specification of process synchronization by path expressions
paper.abstract: A new method of expressing synchronization is presented and the motivations and considerations which led to this method are explained. Synchronization rules, given by ‘path expressions’, are incorporated into the type definitions which are used to introduce data objects shared by several asynchronous processes. It is shown that the methodu0027s ability to express synchronization rules is equivalent to that of P and V operations, and a means of automatically translating path expressions to existing primitive synchronization operations is given.
